Headlines: Axis Bank Q2 Results Review - Deposit Mobilsation Remains Key Focal Point: Systematix
Description:
Axis Bank Ltd. reported Q2 FY24 earnings of Rs 58.6 billion (+10% YoY, +1% QoQ), which was in-line with expectations of Rs 57.8 billion. While net interest income was in-line, lower other income was offset by lower provisions. We introduce FY26 estimates, rollover forecasts to December 2025 and maintain our 'Buy' rating with Dec-24 target price of Rs 1,125 (versus 1,120).

We value Axis Bank at 1.85 times Dec-25 adjusted book value per share. While we continue to expect higher slippage ratio and credit costs over the forecast period,

Headlines: Axis Bank Q2 Net Profit Rises 10% To Rs 5,863 Cr - News18
Description: Shares of Axis Bank closed at Rs 955.35 on Wednesday, down 0.84 per cent over previous close on the BSE.

Headlines: Axis Bank Q2 Results: Profit Rises 10%
Description:
Axis Bank Ltd.'s profit rose 10% year-on-year in the July-September quarter on higher core income, in line with analysts' estimates. However, higher provisions during the quarter affected net profit.

The private sector lender's net profit rose to Rs 5,864 crore, as compared with Rs 5,330 crore a year ago, according to an exchange filing. Analysts polled by Bloomberg estimated a net profit of Rs 5,754 crore for the second quarter.

Headlines: Government Appoints Axis Bank’s Neelkanth Mishra As Part-Time UIDAI Chairperson
Description:
The Union government has appointed Neelkanth Mishra, chief economist at Axis Bank Ltd., as part-time chairperson of the Unique Identification Authority of India.

It also appointed Prof. Mausam, associate professor of computer science department at IIT Delhi, and Nilesh Shah, managing director at Kotak Mahindra Asset Management Co., as part-time UIDAI members, according to a notification by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology on Tuesday.

Headlines: Gun jumping: CCI slaps ₹40 lakhs penalty on Axis Bank
Description: CCI imposes ₹40 lakh penalty on Axis Bank for failing to notify CCI of its 9.91% stake buy in CSC e-Governance. CCI rejected Axis Bank's submission of a bona fide error in assessing the applicability of the De Minimis exemption. The law stipulates that a merger cannot come into effect until 210 days have passed from the date of notifying CCI or until approval by CCI. High fines have been imposed by competition authorities for 'gun jumping' worldwide.

Headlines: Axis Bank to provide Kisan Credit Card, unsecured MSME loans via RBI’s Public Tech Platform
Description: Days after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announced a Pilot for Public Tech Platform for Frictionless Credit (PTPFC), Axis Bank Ltd. has announced the introduction of two lending products--Kisan Credit Card (KCC) and unsecured MSME loans--to small business customers which will be processed through this platform.

Headlines: Max Life Insurance eyeing double digit growth in new business premium this fiscal
Description: Max Life Insurance, a private life insurer, is aggressively expanding with a plan focused on channels, growth, new distribution, and new product launches. Capital raise of ₹ 1612 crore from Axis Bank will help deliver double digit growth in new business premium. Expansion includes 100 new offices in Tier-2 cities, 50,000 agent advisors, and ramping up banca play. Capital raise from Axis Bank will take solvency to 227%. Max Life may look at raising other forms of capital post two years.

Description: PSU banks such as Punjab National Bank and IDBI Bank are expected to move higher and deliver decent gains this week.

Max Life Insurance is a joint venture between Max Financial Services and Axis Bank. Axis Bank along with its entities acquired a 12.99 per cent stake in Max Life in 2021 and through this new investment, they would own 19.02 per cent in the private insurer.

Headlines: Technical Analysis: Apollo Pipes, Axis Bank and Sunteck Realty
Description: Apollo Pipes’ stock shows a bullish trend, with a potential rally expected. Consider buying at ₹722.50, add more at ₹706, and set a stop-loss at ₹690. Book profits at ₹770 or tighten stop-loss at ₹715 if it rises above ₹750. Axis Bank’s stock rally remains positive above trendline support at ₹925. Description: Key Financial Updates For August 2023: Axis Bank is changing benefits for its co-branded Flipkart credit card, SBI special deposit scheme will close during the month, ITR filing will attract penalty

Headlines: Axis Bank Q1 Review - Mixed Results; NIMs To Moderate But Settle At Higher Levels Versus Past: Dolat Capital
Description:
Axis Bank Ltd.'s margins at 4.1% (-12 basis points QoQ) benefitted from impact of Citi assets and higher credit-deposit ratio, despite adverse impact of rise in cost of fund. Axis Bank's operating profit was however hurt by elevated opex as increments and full impact of Citi employee costs had its bearing. Numbers are not comparable on a YoY/QoQ given the impact of merger.
The stock trades at a discount to peers and valuation gap should sustain in the interim. Valuations are nonetheless undemanding. 
Maintain 'Buy' with target price of Rs 1150

Headlines: Axis Bank Q1 Review: Operating Expenses To Stay Elevated Due To Citi Integration Costs
Description:
Axis Bank’s first-quarter earnings were stable compared to market expectations, mainly driven by high core income and other income, according to analysts.

The private lender’s first-quarter net profit rose to Rs 5,797 crore, up 40.5% year-on-year, according to an exchange filing on Wednesday. That was close to market expectations as well. Net interest income increased 27.44% to Rs 11,959 crore from a year ago.

Headlines: Axis Bank Ltd.’s shares rise on Q1FY24 results
Description: Axis Bank's Q1 FY24 results show strong loan growth, leading to a notable increase in its quarterly net profit. NII reached ₹11,959 crore, growing 1.8% q-o-q and 27.4% y-o-y. Share price rose 0.12% to ₹981, despite elevated operational costs due to acquisition of Citi's consumer business. Analyst Shreyansh Shah expects smooth acquisition process to not affect bank's asset quality & bottom line.

Headlines: Axis Bank Q1 Results Review - Net Interest Margins Declined QoQ; Return On Asset At 1.8%: IDBI Capital
Description:
Axis Bank credit growth stood improved to 22% YoY (Citi portfolio impact) led by growth across segments. Asset quality remains stable as gross non-performance asset stood at 1.96% vs led by seasonality. Outstanding Covid restructured assets stood at 0.21%  lower than its peers Net interest income grew  backed by improvement in net interest margins  
Pre-provision operating profit grew backed by lower cost to income ratio. Provisions increased due to higher slippages PAT grew 
Axis Bank  We maintained ‘Buy' rating with target price of Rs 1,140

The S&P 500 gained 0.18% in trade, while Dow Jones fell 0.05%. The Nasdaq also declined 0.53% as of 3:10 p.m. New York time. The gold spot price gained 0.45% to $1,973.78 and brent crude oil declined 0.85% to $82.93.

Headlines: Axis Bank Q1 net profit rises 40% to ₹5,797 crore
Description: Axis Bank posted 40.5% rise in Q1FY24 net profit to ₹5,797cr due to decline in bad loans & improved interest income. Total income rose to ₹30,644cr & NII to ₹11,959cr. Gross NPAs eased to 1.96% & net NPAs to 0.41%. Capital adequacy ratio declined to 17.08%.

Headlines: Axis Bank Q1 Results: Net Profit Up 40.5%
Description:
Private sector lender Axis Bank Ltd. reported a 40.5% year-on-year rise in net profit for the quarter ended June, owing to higher core income and other income.

The lender's net profit rose to Rs 5,797 crore in the first quarter, higher than the Rs 4,125 crore reported a year ago.

Headlines: Axis Bank Q1 Results: Net Profit Surges 41% YoY To Rs 5,797 Crore, NII Up 27% - News18

Headlines: Sensex, Nifty close higher on foreign fund inflows, rally in US equities
Description: Sensex & Nifty bounce back Weds. after buying in infra, banking & oil shares. L&T posts 36% rise in net profit. BSE Sensex up 351.49 pts & Nifty 97.70 pts. Major gainers: L&T, ITC, Reliance, Sun Pharma, Kotak Bank, Axis Bank, Infosys & SBI. Asian markets, Europe & US end in red/positive. FIIs buy equities worth ₹1,088.76 crore.

Headlines: Big banks locked in ‘war’ for large corporate loans
Description: India's top four banks (SBI, HDFC Bank, Bank of Baroda, Axis Bank) could account for ~60% of fresh lending to India Inc. Rates for large corporates are competitive, creating a price war since Sep 2021. AAA-rated entities can borrow at 8-8.5% while A-rated entities at 8.5-8.75%. G-Sec rates are 7.07-7.15%. Banks are vying for other business, such as transaction banking, to make up for low loan pricing.

Headlines: Digital currency pilot gains pace; SBI, HDFC Bank step up campaigns

CBDC offers trust, safety & settlement finality, & can be used for G-Secs, B2G & P2G transactions.

Headlines: LGBTQIA+ Inclusion: Financial Sector Bats at The Forefront, Implementing Progressive Policies
Description: India's finance industry is leading the way in LGBTQIA+ inclusion, with Axis Bank, Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan, Protium and Wells Fargo taking progressive steps to foster inclusivity. These companies offer mediclaim benefits, joint accounts, gender-inclusive policies, train-and-hire models, transgender internships, and gender-neutral harassment policies, empowering the community and providing valuable opportunities.

Headlines: Axis Bank - Strong Trends In Business Momentum; Improving Operating Performance.: KRChoksey
Description:
Axis Bank Ltd. has reported a stellar operating performance in FY23 led by healthy business traction as well as the successful integration of CITI business.  

The bank has strengthened its retail segment led by aggressive focus on customer acquisition as well as improved granularity. CITI business integration will further boost the overall business momentum, especially in the retail segment, and also aids in capturing market share in the retail segment.

Headlines: Nifty Bank Outlook: Buy the dips; HDFC Bank, Axis Bank shares may do well

Headlines: Mahila Samman Saving Certificate facility now available in these public sector banks, four private banks. Check details here
